question_text: A point is on the x-axis. What are its y-coordinate and z-coordinates?
correct_answer: The y-coordinate and z-coordinate are both 0. In other words, any point on the x-axis can be represented as (x, 0, 0) where x is a real number.
explanation: A point on the x-axis lies entirely along that axis, meaning there is no displacement in the y- or z-directions. Therefore, by definition, the y-coordinate and z-coordinate must both be 0, leaving only the x-coordinate as non-zero.

question_text: A point is in the XZ-plane. What can you say about its y-coordinate?
correct_answer: The y-coordinate is 0. Every point in the XZ-plane is of the form (x, 0, z).
explanation: The XZ-plane is defined by the x-axis and z-axis. This means that for any point lying in this plane, there is no displacement along the y-axis. Hence, the y-coordinate must be 0.

question_text:
Fill in the blanks:
(i) The x-axis and y-axis taken together determine a plane known as _______.
(ii) The coordinates of points in the XY-plane are of the form _______.
(iii) Coordinate planes divide the space into ______ octants.
explanation: Explanation: (i) The x-axis and y-axis, when taken together, form the XY-plane because every point in this plane can be described by its x and y values. (ii) In the XY-plane, since there is no height component out of the plane, the z-coordinate for every point is 0, so the coordinates are in the form (x, y, 0). (iii) The three mutually perpendicular coordinate planes divide the three-dimensional space into eight distinct regions known as octants.
